title: Indian Foods
author: PuppetMasters
pages:
Hello, I am an Indian
that know very little
about India. However, I
would like to introduce
some Indian foods
even with my limited
knowledge.






Rice:

We eat a lot of rice,
and according to
Statista.com about 90
grams of uncooked
rice per person.
Typically in my house
we tend to use about
a cup of rice. It's
very versitile which is
what makes it so
popular.
Roti:

Wasn't sure how to
describe it but
according to google it
is a round flat bread
native to India made
from wheat flour and
water. Eaten with a
variety of other
sides, its once again
versatile. In my family,
we eat it any meal.
Dal:

Lentils; my family
tends to eat it often.
As a vegiterian it
tends to make up much
of my protein needs
along with nuts and
beans. Again, very
versitile.



Banana chips:

Very tasty snack,
would reccomend.
Made from deep frying
freshly sliced
bananas. Speaking of
bananas, traditionally
we eat on banana
leaves because it is
considered healthy.
According to my
parents, it also turns
black when touching
poisons so Kings used
it to prevent
assassinations.










Payasum (Kheer)

A sweet wet pudding.
Made by boiling milk,
sugar, and vermicelli
(in my family)







A lot of this is based
on my family, and
therefore does not
represent India as a
whole. Hopefully,
everyone enjoys the
very good food of
India.

-PuppetMasters
